Review title: Alien space craft lost speed? Lost me..
Review_body: How is it that aliens have craft able to travel from millions or billions of miles away and yet when they get to earth suddenly the craft only moves as fast as 1996 USA fighter jets.. Utterly ridiculous premise. Lost me right away. Could not get past that MAJOR hole in the movie. Turned it off..

The two main factors of Independence Day are heroism and the spirit of unity. Actually these two factors are old acquaintances to many film-goers, but they can also move every person who watches this movie. Leading role can focus the power all over the world on saving the earth or human beings. This is the most excited thing in the world I think.Another theme which is usually talked in this sort of disaster movie is humanity. But there is a little in Independence Day, the shrinking violet Secretary of Defense, who is completely different with our young and energetic President Thomas J. Whitmore. Who can save the world? The answer is clear in every audience's heart I suppose.As for the golden combination, Captain Steven Hiller and David Levinson, they separately represent wisdom and courage. Two parts of a prefect saver. This method makes heroes more like an ordinary person by giving each part some weaknesses.David Levinson is a scientist without great aspirations. He has a simple life. He likes laying chess with his old father and riding bike. To him, the life now he has got is the one he wants the most, besides the part of he and his ex-wife. He has been in deep love with his wife even after they got divorced. His charming wife, Constance Spano, is a presidential assistant. Her busy work and his easy life make a sharp contrast in theirs daily life; this contrast is also the reason of their divorce. If Constance were not the Presidential assistant, I think David can't save the world because he has no chance to talk to the President. Captain Steven Hiller is an excellent soldier with a strong body and honesty. People would simply deem that Steven is a nice guy at the first sight of Will Smith's face. Jasmine Dubrow, Steven's girlfriend, who has a little boy and his father isn't Steven. Steven treats him like his own son. We can realize that in the scene of Steven went back to his base, he made a promise of setting fireworks after he accomplish his mission with that little boy. In the end of the final war, the boy watches the fireworks made up by remains of aliens' spaceship.One person breaks the code of aliens' communication and comes up with the idea of saving human beings, the other person has the ability of driving spacecraft, strong body to fight with a real alien and the courage to challenge unknown. These two guys make all the expectations come true. David's idea of beating aliens is implant virus into mother ship of aliens to make all spacecrafts 'get cold '. And it just comes from David's father's comforting words. From the very beginning, they two have no tacit understanding in the battle. I think their only tacit understanding is embracing their beloved woman as soon as possible after winning the war. Maybe love is the real theme of this disaster movie.We have another hero in this movie, the President. He wanted to be a President full of passion and energetic. But there was no opportunity before aliens' invasion of Earth. "I'm a combat pilot, I belong in the air. " This is my most memorable lines. Do you like this kink of president? A president attends a war in person, an act to inspire everyone's patriotism to protect their own nation. The President is a normal person, he loves his cute daughter. But he can not be an ordinary person because he is the President of the United States. He is responsible to the whole National; so he can't express his sorrow of wife's death completely.Aliens are poor, because they are usually beaten by American for strengthening National cohesion and proving the achievement in Special Effects. Everybody has a unique imagination of aliens, but most of them are aggressive. Nobody hates aliens; we all have sympathy for the weak and loathe aggressive part. If men invade other plant for its resource, audiences will also acclaim for men's failure. For example, in the movie Avatar, the audiences applaud for human beings' failure of invading Pandora."Mankind, that word should have new meaning for all of us today. We can't be consumed by our petty differences anymore. We will be united by our common interest. Perhaps its fate that today is 4th of July and you will once again be fighting for our freedom, not from tyranny, oppression or persecution, but from annihilation. We are fighting for our right to live, to exist. And should we win the day, the fourth of July will no longer be known as an American holiday, but as the day when the world declare in one voice we will not go quietly into the night, we will not vanish without a fight, we are going to live on, we are going to survive! Today, we celebrate our Independence Day!"This is president's exciting speech before the final war. And remember: we will not vanish without a fight, we are going to live on, and we are going to survive! Today, we celebrate our Independence Day!

It's pretty simple. If I wanted some logic stuff, I would have done my math homework, however, I wanted to have fun and this movie was exactly what I needed! It was EPIC, that's for sure! It made me sad, sometimes a little scared, got me breathless many times, made me happy, and very, very EXCITED!Some of the lines even made me laugh. It was entertaining, suspenseful, had awesome effects and a lot of emotion, it was just so fun to watch that I'd love to do it again! :]So the question is, why do some people take it so seriously? Enjoy the freaking explosions, the epic virus and God, not to mention the Captain dragging the alien in his parachute to Area 51. This is not a serious movie, and it's perfect the way it is! If you want serious stuff, watch something else, but if you want to see something really fun and really entertaining, you're at the right place! ENJOY!

In 1996 the movie Independence Day was released. Also known as ID4 this movie starts out with a scene of the first man on the moon and that the American's came in peace for all mankind. On July 2nd aliens from another planet enter the earth's atmosphere with their mother spaceship and many other smaller spacecraft attached. They plan to invade and destroy the world starting with all major cities. At first the Americans try to come in peace and send a message to the alien mother ship. They respond by blowing up the helicopter and all other surrounding aircraft. At this time president Thomas J. Whitmore (Bill Pullman) learns by help of David Levinson (Jeff Goldblum) that the aliens are using our own satellite system against us and will destroy the world in a short period of time. The president then orders everyone to leave the cities and prepare for destruction. Then the alien's strike they blow up and destroy major cities all around the world in their first attack. The United States set up a counter attack to destroy the mother ship when they learn that the alien space craft has a protective shield that none of our weapons can penetrate. U.S. air force captain Steven Hiller (Will Smith) is one of the only few survivors in this counter attack and he beings down a small alien space craft and captures an alien and brings him to a secret lab/ army base called area 51. The aliens continue destroying cities and president Whitmore is forced to engage in nuclear warfare with the aliens to destroy them. However the protective shield around the alien space craft cannot be penetrated by a nuclear bomb. Many of Americans have died at this point and the president and every other world leader is distressed. At this point David Levinson who figured out they were using the worlds satellite system against us realizes that the protective shield around the space craft's works off of an advanced computer system. By giving that system a computer virus the shield will be dropped and then the military can attack them. They plan an attack with the whole world on many different space craft because once the mother ship is infected with the virus then all the smaller ships will be also. Capitan Steven Hiller teams up with David and Steven will fly the recovered alien spacecraft from area 51 into the mother ship and David will implant the computer virus. The rest of able Americans and other pilots around the world are ready to attack. Once inside the mother ship Steven and David get locked in to the system and implant the virus. Their protective shields are now ineffective and the Americans begin to attack the smaller ships. They destroy them and then Capitan Hiller and David set off their nuclear bomb in the mother ship and they fly out in their spacecraft. The mother ship explodes into millions of pieces and David and Steven make a safe landing back on earth and return to their families. The aliens have been defeated. The central theme of this movie is heart and never giving up. The human race did not give up once on fighting for their freedom. Even after many counter attacks failed they proved that they were not going to go down without a fight and they all came together and worked together to save their world from destruction. Throughout this movie the sound effects of the explosions and the flying shrapnel and fire make this movie very realistic. After many counter attacks have failed you can see the distress on the president's face in a close up when he gives the order to nuke them. Overall this movie is very well written, action packed and very realistic. Watching this movie feels like you are really there and you become part of it because it is so intense. This was a great movie and I would recommend it to anyone.

Review title: Take a second look, it's not that bad.
Review_body: I have heard many people ripping into Independence Day as one of the worst films that they have seen in a long time, I disagree. In 1997 the film won an Academy Award for best visual effects, and was nominated for sound. For the time the CGI in this film was amazing, and the sound wasn't too bad, the nominations and awards were deserving. The film was also the movie that basically launched Will Smith's carreer into stardom, that says something too. I am having to write a college paper on the movie, which has caused me to watch the movie three times in one day, and I must say that the acting hold through the entire movie, and the storyline isn't as bad as one might initally think, The President isn't overly agressive, and violent minded, the aliens are obviously greatly superior, and there isn't too much time taken in Star Trek style explaining, rather the problems are shown to be solved or explained within the natural dialouge. Yeah, there are holes in the story, yeah this isn't the greatest movie ever made, and yeah some of the dialouge is corny, but remember it's an action movie, and made to be fun, not groundbreaking or earth shattering, just fun. And as a fun movie it has succeeded, when I saw Independence Day in theaters it was the last movie I ever saw where the audience actually cheered, when people cheer for characters how can it all be bad, besides, it's no Battlefield Earth...

Review title: Could this movie be anymore stupid?
Review_body: If there was a contest to show one country's cliché and stereotypes in a feature film, and doing it without anyone involved in the creation process realizing it, I believe ID4 would win hands down.Everything in that movie reeks of stupidity...well, mostly the plotline and the dialog, but the actors go along with it and, even if it pays the rent (of their palaces) it must be hard sometimes to brush your morale standard under the rug for the brainlessness of that movie. To put things into perspective, since I write this comment almost seven years after the movie came out, I find it pretty amusing that this movie coins some of the most outrageous and ass-inine (hyphen on purpose) ideas ever developped for a motion picture such as using a mac to spread a computer virus onto an alien spacecraft, or showing aliens sustaining bullet wounds without so much as a blink and be knocked out for several hours with a single punch in the face or also - last one, I promise - the president of the US hopping into an f18 and flying like his last flight was yesterday...while no one questions why, yes WHY he knows how to fly one of these birds...In summary, I think ID4 deserves to be #1 of the bottom 100 chart. Yup, even worse than from Justin to Kelly because the latter is shameless and open about its mediocrity, riding on just enough hype to last through the summer and appeal to acne-ridden teens, but at least it's honest and it's not trying to treat the audience as a mindless pack of idiots incapable of realizing the 2 hour long shortcoming that ID4 represents. <rage fading>

Review title: A blend of Humour, heroic fights and thrill make this movie a big hit. Suitable for all aged viewers.Enjoy!
Review_body: In this movie, The President of USA ( Bill Pullman) has to deal with an alien visit, and do his best to save his country and family. In the quest for survival, Captain Steven Hiller (Will Smith) leaves his girlfriend, an exotic dancer ( Vivica Fox) and her son, to go back to work after a gigantic UFO gives an unexpected visit to New York City by floating just above. David Levinson (Jeff Goldblum), the ex-husband of Constance Spano (Margaret Colin) who happens to be the assistant of the President, discovers that the UFO and aliens floating above the city are not on a friendly visit instead, they are waiting to attack them. They are flight but many die. After a tough fight, Captain Steven and David Levinso manages to save the earth and its survivors by destroying the Alien Ship and its occupants. All this happens between July 3rd and July 4th. After the end of the battle, July 4th will be claimed as the Independence Day Of America, so were the words of The President.

Bad story line. Filming is ok special effects.... What can I say.. really 1996
It does not grab you. However. I didn't turn it off. So the must be something that was worth watching. But I don't know what.

Contains Spoilers (if it is actually possible to spoil this film further)This probably has to be the worst film ever made (per dollar spent). OK, perhaps not the very worst, Godzilla was even worse, but it's still a terrible film. It should have been so good too. What better scenario could there be for a big budget sci-fi film than the invasion of the Earth by an alien race? It started off quite promisingly too, the first half hour was quite enjoyable. But then it deteriorates into typical Hollywood 'movie-making-by-numbers' drivel. There's the ridiculous comedy moments such as our hero Smith punching an alien after a spaceship crash, the washed-up, drunk ex-serviceman who will come good in the end to save the day, the implausible ending, etc, etc. The excruciatingly over sentimental scenes that all US films seem to insist on torturing the rest of us with (such as the scene with the president and his kid, or the nauseating speech to his troops) are almost unwatchable unless you have a particularly strong stomach or a handy bucket. My advice would be to watch another film, any other film... except Godzilla.

I first saw it in 1998, and since then it has been the movie I compare all other movies to.Even the holy Star Wars series takes second to Independence Day.It has everything. Drama, action, horror, romance, sci-fi, and LOTS of comedy make this movie the ultimate movie of 1996.The soundtrack, written by a Brit, is more patriotic than anything John Phillip Sousa wrote.If you have never seen this movie, drop all that you are doing and rent it.No. Buy it.You won't be wasting your money.

I see a bunch of folks here railing against the movie - how dumb it is, how stoopid the aliens are, how stoopid we are, how it's so unbelievable, yadda yadda whuppity splash.HELLO! It's a science-fiction movie! It's made in the style and tradition of the 50's B-movies like "It Came From Outer Space". It's not supposed to be a deep philosophical discussion about Man Against The Universe, nor an attempt to seriously visualize the possible consequences of alien invasion. It's meant to be good fun, watching Our Heroes struggle valiantly against The Evil Alien Hordes. This is brain candy, not brain food. Accept it as such and enjoy it. If you're looking for Proust in film form, you're doomed to disappointment. If you're not, then you should be able to enjoy the White House being blown up, a jarhead fighter jock gloating as he gets to drive something really cool, and yes, even the cheesy reference to 2001: A Space Odyessey" and the concept of a Powerbook being able to bring down an alien computer network should not dampen your enjoyment. Take it for what it is - fluff made on a big scale.

Fiction and fantasy should keep some reasonable foundations. Rather illogical that you connect with an alien PC and transfer a virus, never experienced how complex are communications between human devices? The American President as a pilot to save the world is absurd.American-centric movie. The typical US army against the evil, in this case the aliens who are not ready to dialog, but just kill us. By the way, how can we pretend to translate Aliens language, not to mention the fact that they have the same logical concepts in their mind.The only interesting features are the various reference to other movies, in this case showing no originality at all.

Independence Day is one of the worst movies ever made. BORING and incessantly annoying: not funny, not hip, not cute, and the epitome of Hollywood formulas at their most bloated and uninspired. This idiotic movie represents how the special effects in Hollywood are emphasized to cover up for poorly written scripts. If a studio injects enough hype into a special effects fest with a few popular actors, the public does indeed usually gobble it up. Fine, you get the cinematic equivalent of what Burger King and Taco Bell are for nutrition...gobble it up, folks. Whoever got thumbs up to produce this crap must have a rich uncle in showbiz. It was depressing to see someone like Mr. Hirsch involved in such rubbish.

This is the movie that became the template for all the incredibly stupid, formulaic summer blockbusters we've seen in the past 10 years. It's a very simple formula. Start with a big, supposedly awe inspiring special effect of some destructive force(giant radioactive lizard, resurrected Egyptian sorcerer, devastating climate change, long dormant volcano becoming active in a major metropolitan area, newly sentient combat jet wreaking havoc on home soil, etc, etc, etc) . Then show people fleeing in terror from this force. Enter some young, handsome/beautiful protagonist who, unlike the herd of fleeing people who are unceremoniously slaughtered, survives the onslaught by virtue of, I don't know, their box office drawing power. Finally we come to the inevitable "climactic" conclusion where our hero manages to overcome/defeat this force by way of a completely implausible plot contrivance(in the case of this movie, a computer virus created by an earthling on an earth computer being uploaded to and working on an alien computer system). In order to enjoy these movies you have to forget all the movies exactly like it that have come before it and disable your higher reasoning abilities. Every movie asks that you suspend your disbelief to one degree or another but they shouldn't ask that you shut down your brain as well.I know I'm missing parts of the formula so if anybody thinks of any others feel free to share.

Review title: 6.9 - Are you kidding me?! This is the pinnacle of global cinema!!
Review_body: To rate Independence Day a 6.9 is an absolute travesty. The film set new benchmarks in the sci-fi genre and redefined the 4th of July celebration in the USA. To say that Will Smith's performance as a family man who dreams of becoming an astronaut is weak and one-dimensional, is an insult to any Oscar award ever won, both in the past and in the future. This film defined Will Smith's career and cemented him in history as the greatest actor there has ever been. Bill Pullman as the US President is a casting choice of pure genius and it would be fair to say that this is the greatest depiction of a Presidential role ever portrayed in a cinematic production. The President donning a jumpsuit and flying with his comrades to join the front line against the aliens epitomizes the sentiment of the founding fathers of the United States of America. Furthermore, it was this film, and this film alone, that inspired Barack Obama himself to run for office. Jeff Goldblum also gives an extraordinary performance that would indeed cause aliens to flock to Earth to witness his acting, had it not been for the outrageous 6.9 rating.To conclude, Independence Day is an artistic masterpiece and sheds light on the harrowing security flaws of our world. We now realise who can be counted on; Will Smith, Bill Pullman and Jeff Goldblum, and all thanks to the directing perfection of Mr Roland Emmerich. 10/10 and the rest.

The film shows great amounts of special effects especially for the time, almost every one of the actors deserves a credit because they all hold their own very well on the big screen, the movie is clustered with motivational moments, tied with romance, and action, a must see for an action, adventure, and comedy fan. Jeff Goldblum holds his own as always as the intelligent one, and Will smith will always be an excellent comic relief and action character, the film portrays an array of other wonderful actors, even the amazingly talented Harry Connick Jr. has a small but well played part in the film. Bill Pullman plays a good president and shows that his ability to do motivational speeches is in anything but short supply. In summary, a good film, a good watch, in my top 20.

Review title: A way of being incredibly stupid
Review_body: It could be interesting to watch the CGI, but it is the stupidest film to watch. Remember; it's about aliens taking over the earth. A lot of people keep saying "Oh My God" or "My God" or just "God...", and it goes on and on and on. It's all about aliens taking over the earth, with the earth being OK with it. Awful. It's a great drinking game - if someone says "God", take a shot. If they say "My God!" Take 2 drinks. If they say "Oh, My God!" Take 3 drinks. I imagine you will all be screwed within 20 minutes. It's not a film that I would recommend to anyone - it is not a film that I think would be reactive. There are characters who die in the original who show up again in the next version. It seems that the only reason "God" is in the mix is the fact that it is "God" - simple and ridiculous. Erik

I enjoyed this movie, however, I felt it was nothing more than a modernized remake of "The War of the Worlds" from 1953 starring Gene Barry. Many of the plot themes in both movies are similar, if not the same. There is the issue of atomic weapons which is the same in both movies. The results were identical. The issue of the common cold in the 1953 movie has been replaced with a computer virus in Independence Day. I hope the 2005 version of "War of the Worlds" backs me up and that people who never saw the 1953 movie won't think that the new "War of the Worlds" is a remake of Independence Day, which, of course, it isn't.

Nothing about this dreadful film offers compensation for sitting through what seems like an eternity while watching it. The effects are fine, OK, but absolutely nothing else can possibly be recommended it to anyone with more than a single active brain cell. Avoid this rubbish! The characters are the most clichéd of clichés and no viewer will care one jot about them. No-one involved takes it seriously and hamming saves the day in more than one respect. There have been many comments concerning the saving of the world by the USA - again! - but that is not important. What is important is that a reasonable and possibly exciting storyline has been smothered at birth by incompetent translation. All I could hope for was victory for the aliens then we would surely never have to sit through this Hollywood garbage again.

One of my all-time favorite films!!!!! Will Smith is my King and the speech carried out by Mr. President really amazed me and I've even learned this by heart! Even until today, I can still repeat what he said in the movie.Good Morning! In less than an hour, aircraft from here will join others from around world. We will be launching the largest aerial battle in the history of mankind. Mankind, the word should have new meanings fro all of us today. We can't be consumed by our petty differences any more. We will be united in our common interests.Perhaps it's fate that today is 4th of July, and we will once again be fighting for our freedom, not from tyranny oppression or persecution, but from annihilation. We are fighting for our right to live, to exist. And should we win the day, the 4th of July will no longer be known as an American holiday. But at the day when we declare we will not go quietly into the night. We will not vanish without a fight! We are going to live on! We are going to survive! Today we celebrate our Independence Day!

Review title: A cool movie which celebrates the human life
Review_body: It was awesome, and that's coming from a 14 year old who dislikes movies that come from before 2001. It is a story that centers around the problem we now have: are we alone in the universe? And if we aren't, then are the other life forms hostile? In this movie they are and they are coming for all our big cities. The story is told from an American point of view. The American president has to struggle with that weasel, I don't remember what his job was, to prevent Earth from being destroyed by radioactive waste. It's good to see the president's optimism. He wants to preserve Earth, because he thinks that we will survive the aliens.

This is a terrible movie.The acting is dire across the board. The premise, which had promise,was let down by terrible scripting, plot holes, inconsistencies not to mention racist and homophobic undertones.CGI was poor but passable. Seriously stupid stuff which truly insults it's audience and fan base. I was really looking forward to this too. I even own limited copies of the first film which I bought on pre order.Waste of time and money. Anyone involved in this should be ashamed.Don't bother with this movie.

Cheese set aside, ID4 is a great family popcorn movie. Not too scary for the little ones and still enough exploding landmarks to keep even the most twisted inner child entertained for the 2 1/2 hours.No, the Empire State Building wasn't portrayed technically accurate, and you can see strings attached to the aliens in a couple of shots, but they look more realistic for the closeups than some Shrekian Toy story "Space Edition" like some of the other sci-fi movies of late.CGI aliens all look like video games instead of movies and ID4 really had that slimy, natural alien look and feel judging from the generous heaping of oozing secretions while Data does his Alien Autopsy (Brent Spiner from Star Trek NG plays one of the socially inept scientists living sheltered at area 51).I've seen ID4 hundreds of times, and it is still better than the remake of War of the Worlds done almost a decade later.-HW

Review title: Loved the original movie, not so with versions circulating now.
Review_body: I enjoyed this movie in 1996 but the version they are showing on TV now is missing a lot of detail and has been edited to be almost unrecognizable. It's a darn shame what has been done to this movie. It has been horribly edited and misses some truly potent scenes. Very disappointed.

Review_body: I'm assuming that the tag 'one of the biggest grossing films of all time' is a typo and they really mean one of the grossest films ever made i am by no means anti American but the flag waving patriotism here is stomach churning, the dialogue pathetic and the characters and coincidences so unbelievable as to render any suspension of disbelief impossible.2 stars for some good special effects- if you must see this steaming pile of crap fast forward through all but the sfx set pieces -what a waste of time ,money and some very fine actors ( Jeff goldblum, will smith, Mary McDonnell )

This movie, as correctly perceived as a modern "War of the Worlds", still has me glued to the TV whenever it is on. I think that this movie is great. I liked this movie because I'm into all the high tech command centers and military and things like that. Ronald is a very talented director and i think his newest film "The day after tomorrow" is another, Hollywood, big budget film. I really think that his films are great. Everyone should watch this movie. It's the best!!!!!!!!

Review title: Amazing script, amazing acting, amazing screenplay...
Review_body: ID4 easily stands as one of the best of the 90's, a time when sci-fi and patriotism were not easily accepted.How does one appeal to the masses screaming for realism? First, barrage them with a cast of competent, well-known actors. Now that you have everyone's attention, actually follow through with a script meant to encompass each and every one of those actors. This is where most movies fail, sometimes miserably, but not Independence Day. Must-see movie for anybody willing to keep an open mind. Remember, it's just pretend.I have only one complaint, (which is extremely rare, believe me) and that is the acting of Harvey Fierstein. Almost comparable to that of Jake Lloyd (Anakin Skywalker). Almost.

Independence Day, the film represents one of the typical American national characters with a simple way. Aliens attack our earth in order to take our freedom. First, the President of United States hopes that it is the best way of living to develop a friendship between aliens and mankind. However, the attackers continue to invade the earth. There are no hopes for our children in their future. Therefore, we, the Americans, have to fight against the enemies.This film contains several interesting points of the present world situation. People make an effort to create a good relationship between each countries but we have not found the answer yet. As a result, people have been killed at this moment unfortunately. I like this film because it shows the possibility to make a blight future for us. It cannot be always seen a happy end for everyone, but we can challenge to create the new world. This film gives us some energy to find the way. The positive attitude is the most important for us to break down the bad circumstance. I felt that I could save the world after I saw this film.
